events.name: November Meetup
events.description: Hi folks!  We look forward to having you join us for our November meetup, on the 24th, venue @ NDC, Level 3. We're still looking for speakers! Ping us (Winston or Guo Xiang) if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Random Ruby Tips.  See you on the 24th! Venue:  IDA Labs Level 3 @ National Design Centre -------------- 1. "Things we learnt from IT Audit" - Bregadeesh, Luxola 2. "First experience with Jenkins and Rails Engine" - Reuben 3. "5 Random Ruby Tips"- Justin Louie, CTO GuavaPass.com * Hot Picks- This is a 5-10 minutes session during which anyone canstand up and say something interesting!  -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack,your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices,so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips"that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must havecame across some interesting Ruby nuggets in thelast month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw / winstonyw@gmail.com,or Guo Xiang @tgx_world / tgx_world@hotmail.com See you all soon! --------------Job Postings-------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting?Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- 1. SourceClear is a software security startup and they are looking to hire a Ruby on Rails developer in Singapore to work on their open community site -<a>https://open.srcclr.com.</a> More info here:  https://jobs.lever.co/srcclr/c9d8bf4c-c8d9-4df7-b346-cf2f45d6c7df Thank You, Sponsors! Food and Drinks:   Venue:
events.location: IDA Labs Level 3 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #03-04, 188969, Singapore

events.name: Book Club: Architecture of Open Source – Audacity & Web Distributed Systems
events.description: Read The Architecture of Open Source Applications online. This week we'll be covering the chapters on Audacity and Scalable Web Architecture and Distributed Systems. At the end of each week's meetup we will take a vote to select ~two chapters from any of the three AOSA Volumes available. If there's a particular chapter you want us to cover, attend the next meetup and cast your vote!  "If you are a junior developer, and want to learn how your more experienced colleagues think, these books are the place to start. If you are an intermediate or senior developer, and want to see how your peers have solved hard design problems, these books can help you too." How Book Club Works1. Read the chapter before you come to the meetup.2. Find something in the chapter you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting.4. Group discussion and banter ensues! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Bring snacks! Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Drupal 8 Launch Party
events.description: Drupal 8 will be released on 19 November 2015. We are going to celebrate it on 24 November in Singapore with short presentation on D8 and lots of food, drinks and chats. Developers, business owners, friends and families are invited. Mark your calendar and RSVP early to avoid disappointment.

events.name: dplyr tricks
events.description:
Hi everyone, I would like to suggest a dplyr discussion session. My vision is that the expert users in our group could come forward and share some tips and tricks that they have figured out after using dplyr for some time. It would be sort of an open-mic session. As such, it will not be a tutorial on dplyr; but a session to find out and share solutions with others.  If you have some expertise, please get in touch with me to let me what you would be interested to share, and I can arrange a schedule. If each person just talks for 5-10 minutes with a short example, it would be wonderful. For my part, I propose to talk about the following: 1. using dplyr verbs within other functions. (use of the standard evaluation versions of filter, select, etc.) 2. window functions with dplyr. (Date is fixed for Nov 24th) 


In addition, this meetup will be sponsored by O'Reilly, who are organising a Big Data Conference in Singapore from Dec 1 to 3rd: http://conferences.oreilly.com/strata/big-data-conference-sg-2015 We have some free swag to give away from O'Reilly, and if you wish to register for the conference, they are offering a 20% discount to our users with discount code UGRUGS. Use this link to register: http:/oreil.ly/SHWSG15UG
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989
